Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed in a restraint/escort, youth and staff fell and the
youth hit the sink/toilet and obtained an injury.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported the situation that occurred was “stupid”. Youth A
reported he needs very specific instructions, and he was upset as
he was told to shower and then would be given his snack. When
Youth A got out of the shower and asked for his snack, he was
told he needed to wait which made him upset. Youth A reported
he stood by the back hall door leading to the pod area refusing to
move. Staff 6 called a code 2. Youth A reported several staff
responded to the code 2. Staff were telling Youth A to move away
from the door area. Youth A reported he was refusing to move.
Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s left arm. Staff 1 laid his hand on Youth
A’s right arm. Youth A told Staff 1 and Staff 2 not to touch him.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 placed him in an escort and started to move
him. Youth A reported he did not try to hit any staff. Youth A
2

reported he was resisting and may have moved his arms saying,
“let go”. Several staff, Youth A could not recall specifically which
staff, opened the nearest bedroom door and were taking items out
of the bedroom. Youth A was escorted into the bedroom and
reported he banged the left side of his forehead on the door
frame. Youth A reported he was escorted into the corner of the
bedroom. Youth A reported while he was in the corner his head
hit the wall several times. Youth A reported it was hard to
describe however staff had him in a bent down position and some
staff started to leave the bedroom. Youth A reported he started to
sit up and Staff 1 called for additional staff to come back into the
bedroom. Youth A reported several staff came back into the
bedroom and started grabbing him “everywhere”. Staff began
moving him and rotating his body to the right to get into a kneeling
position in front of the bed. Youth A pushed off the bed to get up
with his hands and his head “slammed” on the corner of the sink
from staff trying to move him. Youth A reported he did not recall
everything that happened. Youth A reported this was the first time
he was restrained at the facility. Youth A reported he was
resisting the restraint. Youth A reported he received a cut on his
eyebrow. Youth A refused to allow nursing staff to see the cut and
was taken to the hospital by the Sheriff’s Department for medical
attention.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B was in the back hall
when Youth A became upset over not getting his snack. Youth A
was refusing to follow Staff 6’s directions to move away from the
door and return to his chair. Staff 6 called a code 2 for the
supervisor to come assist. Staff 1 responded as the supervisor
assistance call. Staff 1 and Staff 6 were talking to Youth A telling
him to move away from the door and to go to his bedroom. Youth
A continued to refuse. Additional staff came however Youth B did
not recall all the staff. Youth B reported staff “grabbed” Youth A
by his arms and were trying to move him to the closest bedroom.
Youth B reported staff were “pushing and pulling” Youth A to get
him to move as Youth A was refusing to move and was standing
still in place. Youth B did not recall all the staff involved however
reported Staff 1 had one of Youth A’s arms “pulling” Youth A and
Staff 2 was standing behind Youth A “pushing” Youth A into the
bedroom. Staff 1 told Youth B he needed to go into his bedroom
and Staff 6 went down to get Youth B into his bedroom. Youth B
reported Youth A was resisting going to the bedroom by not
moving with staff. Youth A was not making any threatening
statements nor were staff. Youth B reported he saw staff,
unspecific who other than Staff 1 and Staff 2, “push” Youth A into
3

the bedroom. Youth B did not see anything that occurred once
Youth A was in the bedroom. Youth B reported he talked to Youth
A after the incident and Youth A told him when staff tried to
“throw” him into the bedroom, he fell and hit his head on the
sink/toilet area causing a cut on his eyebrow. Youth B reported he
has been restrained while at the facility. Youth B reported when
he was restrained, he complied and walked on his own to his
bedroom and did not have to go into any position for staff to exit
his bedroom. Youth B reported he does not like the food at the
facility. Youth B reported he believes the food is undercooked
however he completed a grievance regarding this concern and
was informed that meat thermometers are used to ensure food is
cooked to the correct temperature. Youth B reported receiving
three meals a day at the facility and two snacks.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
worked with Youth A the day prior to the restraint where Youth A
was refusing to go to his bedroom. Staff 1 talked with Youth A.
Youth A reported when he gets quiet it means he has no intention
to cooperate, and he has nothing to lose as he is going to jail.
Staff 1 reported he took this information into account during the
situation on 11/8/2023. Staff 1 was called to Youth A’s pod for a
code 2. Youth A was in the back hallway trying to get through the
door. Staff 1 unlocked the door and opened it in a position to
have his back to Youth A to allow other youth to exit the area.
Additional staff also came into the back hallway to assist. Staff 1
then closed the door and turned to Youth A. Youth A had his arm
on the glass window. Staff 1 placed his hand on Youth A’s arm in
a hanging position. Staff 2 was on Youth A’s left side and had his
hand relaxed on Youth A. Youth A was upset about snack. Staff
1 told Youth A he would get him his snack, but Youth A needed to
go to his bedroom as it was bedtime. Youth A stated, “fuck that
you guys are going to give me what I want”. Staff 1 attempted to
use verbal de-escalation however it was not working. Supervisor
2 then stepped in and also tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A
and reassured Youth A he would get his snack once he went to
his bedroom. Youth A began making verbal threats that he was
going to “swing” on the next person that touched him. Staff 1
moved his hand from the glass at this time to lay over Youth A’s
wrist area to be in a position to prevent Youth A from hitting staff if
he attempted to. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were reading each other as
they have both worked at the facility for a long time. Youth A
began to pull his arms away from Staff 1 and Staff 2 at which time
Youth A was placed into a high-level haptics position. Staff 1
explained this as securing Youth A’s arm in a hooked position.
4

Youth A began kicking and throwing his body weight back and
forth. Staff 2 fell off balance slightly and was able to regain
balance. Staff 1 and Staff 2 moved Youth A to be positioned
against the wall for stability. Supervisor 2 walked behind Staff 1
and Staff 2 to get them away from the wall and support in the
event someone was thrown off balance. The decision was made
to move Youth A to the nearest bedroom. The bedroom was
emptied quickly by staff. While escorting Youth A into the
bedroom, Staff 3 stood behind to make sure no one fell during the
transport. Staff 1 went through the bedroom doorframe and Youth
A grabbed ahold of the door frame. Staff 1 reported he did not
know what exactly happened however Staff 2 fell and disengaged
from Youth A’s left arm. Staff 3 stepped in, and resecured Youth
A’s left arm and they all fell forward as Youth A was struggling to
get out of the hold. Youth A was on his left side on the bed pulling
his arm from Staff 3. Staff 1 still had Youth A’s right arm secured.
At this time, it was only Staff 1, Staff 3, and Youth A in the
bedroom as all the other staff had exited the bedroom. Staff 1 told
the other staff to come back in to assist. Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff
5 entered the bedroom. Youth A was resisting and Staff 1
directed staff to secure Youth A’s legs. Staff, unsure who, secured
Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 directed staff to rotate Youth A to the right
as Youth A was laying on his side and staff were trying to re-
engage to secure Youth A, during this rotation, Youth A moved a
leg to the bed and went to stand up causing all staff and Youth A
to fall forward and to the ground. Youth A fell forward hitting his
right eyebrow area on the sink/toilet area. Staff 1 saw there was
blood and Youth A began to escalate more. Staff were able to get
Youth A into position for staff to safely exit the bedroom. Staff 1
described Youth A being in a safe position for staff to exit the
bedroom as Youth A was kneeling with his legs crossed and his
arms behind his back with Youth A’s upper body lying on the bed.
Once all staff exited the bedroom and closed Youth A in the
bedroom, Staff 1 notified the on-call administrator and contacted
nursing staff. Nursing staff came down to evaluate Youth A
however Youth A refused to allow nursing to assess him as he
used the mattress to cover the bedroom window. The Sheriff’s
Department was contacted and came and took Youth A to the
hospital for medical treatment. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
restrained per the trained CPI technique. Staff 1 reported CPI
model trains to disengage and reengage if safe to do so. Staff 1
reported he did not feel the situation was safe to disengage and
reengage due to Youth A’s aggressive behavior as Youth A was
making verbal threats during the restraint that he was going to
assault staff, Youth A was pushing, pulling, and throwing his body
weight around in a fighting mode and had his fist balled ready to
5

hit staff. Staff 1 reported no staff pushed Youth A at any time
during the restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
responded to the code 2 call. Youth A was wedged in the corner
of the back hall between the drinking fountain and door. Staff 2
joined Staff 1 and Staff 6 in a “safety circle” and were attempting
to talk to Youth A who was upset that he did not get his snack.
Staff 1 told Youth A he would get him his snack however Youth A
needed to follow directions and go to his bedroom. Youth A
continued demanding his snack. Youth A was asked several
times to go to his bedroom. There was another code 2 in the
building at the same time. Staff 2 reported he was on Youth A’s
left side, and he placed an open hand on Youth A’s back while
talking to him to encourage Youth A to move to his bedroom.
Youth A then began to make threats to staff saying he was going
to hit staff. Staff 2 moved his hand from Youth A’s back to Youth
A’s arm to have control if Youth A began to try to hit staff. Staff 2
and Staff 1 continued trying to talk to Youth A however were also
aware of each other in case they needed to go into a hold with
Youth A. Youth A continued to escalate and began moving his
arms to get away from Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 and Staff 2
transitioned to a two-man CPI hold to transport Youth A to the
nearest bedroom. Youth A began to resist during the transport to
the bedroom. Staff 1 and Staff 2 stopped the transport and held
Youth A in the two-man CPI hold to let him get his energy out.
Youth A continued to try to break free from the two-man hold.
Staff 2 reported the bedroom was about five feet away, so he and
Staff 1 continued to transport Youth A to the bedroom although
Youth A was resisting. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were
clearing out the bedroom. Staff 1 and Staff 2 got Youth A into the
bedroom and got to the bed and begin to adjust Youth A’s position
to get out of the bedroom. Staff 2 reported he disengaged from
Youth A however was not sure what happened causing him to
disengage. Youth A was still escalated, and Staff 1 still was in the
hold with Youth A. Youth A went to stand up causing staff and
Youth A to fall forward and Youth A hit his head on the sink/toilet.
Youth A then fell on his stomach on the bed. Staff 2 saw blood.
Staff were then able to exit the bedroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3
responded to the code 2 on Youth A’s pod. Staff 3 arrived on the
pod and Staff 1 standing with his hand on the wall next to Youth A.
Youth A was escalated and was making verbal threats to staff and
6

peers. Staff 3 remained out on the pod area as Staff 1 and Staff 2
were behind the locked door that goes to the back hall with Youth
A. Staff 3 did not see what happened resulting in Staff 1 and Staff
2 to go hands on with Youth A. Once Staff 1 and Staff 2 had
Youth A in a two-man standing escort and were against the wall
with Youth A, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 opened the door to the
back hall and went to assist. Staff 3 reported he assisted in
getting the closest bedroom door open and items out of the
bedroom. Staff 3 did not see Youth A hit his head on the door
frame when Staff 1 and Staff 2 escorted Youth A into the
bedroom. Staff 3 reported once Youth A was in the bedroom,
Youth A was refusing to sit on the bed to allow staff to exit the
bedroom safely. Staff 3 report staff, unable to recall which specific
staff, were attempting to turn Youth A on the slab to get him into a
safe position to allow staff to exit the bedroom. Youth A continued
to be escalated and was able to get lose from the restraint and fell
forward hitting his head on the toilet/sink area. Staff 3 reported
Youth A fell due to a variety of reasons including Youth A moving
in the restraint as well as staff trying to turn Youth A into a safe
position. Staff 3 reported he was holding Youth A’s legs in the
restraint. Youth A was trying to get staff off him and was
“thrashing” his body. Staff 3 did not see Youth A hit his head on
the bedroom wall at any point and reported Youth A was never
close enough to the wall to hit his head. Staff 3 reported once
Youth A fell and hit his eyebrow area, there was blood. Staff
exited the room and called nursing to come assess Youth A’s
injury.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 was
in the pod dayroom when code 2 was called. Staff 1 and Staff 2
were trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 4 was in the
pod dayroom with Staff 5 who informed him Youth A was
escalated over a snack. Staff 4 reported he saw Staff 1 and Staff
2 place Youth A in a two-man standing escort however did not see
what lead up to placing Youth A in the escort. Staff 4 went back to
the back hall to assist. As Staff 1 and Staff 2 were escorting
Youth A into the bedroom, he noticed Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A
stopped in the doorway however was unsure why. Staff 4
reported Staff 2 was starting too fall so Staff 4 stepped in and
secured Youth A’s left arm from Staff 2. Staff 4 reported it all
happened very quick and he did not recall how he was able to
secure Youth A’s left arm. Once in the bedroom Youth A was
partially on the bed on his left side. Youth A was making threats
to staff that he was going to hit them. Youth A was still in the two-
man escort hold as Youth A’s arms were still secured while he
7

was partially on the bed. Staff 1 directed Staff 4 to roll Youth A
over as Youth A was leaning on the bed in the corner of the wall
kicking at staff. Youth A was asked to go on his knees. Youth A
was resisting. While trying to roll Youth A over from his side,
Youth A was sliding down the bed and staff were moving with
Youth A. Youth A was able to stand up, Staff 4 was unsure how.
Staff 4 reported he did not have a hold on Youth A when he fell.
Staff 4 reported when Youth A stood up, Staff 4 did not have his
arm secured as another staff, unsure who, as Staff 4 was
attempting to secure Youth A’s right arm which Staff 1 had
previously had. Staff 4 reported he did not know what caused the
fall. Staff 4 reported Youth A hit his head on the sink/toilet area.
Staff 4 never saw Youth A hit his head while entering the
bedroom. Staff 4 reported Youth A was kicking his leg while in the
corner of the bedroom and the momentum Youth A was using to
kick his leg did result in Youth A hitting his head on the wall one to
two times.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 was
the float working on Youth A’s pod on 11/8/2023. Youth A was in
“back hall” meaning Youth A received a consequence for his
behavior and was to sit in a chair outside his bedroom door and
read a book. Youth A was not following “back hall” expectations
and was fidgeting with doorknobs and talking with other youth also
on “back hall”. Youth A and another youth planned to get extra
dinners for that night as well as extra snack. Staff 5 provided
Youth A with his evening snack and Youth A placed it on his chair
and went to the bathroom. The other youth took Youth A’s snack
as they planned. Youth A came out of the bathroom demanding
another snack. Staff 5 notified Staff 1 about the situation. Staff 1
was dealing with another situation in the building and stated he
would be there soon to address the snack. Staff 5 went and
began working with other youth in the pod main area. Staff 6 was
in the “back hall” with Youth A and two other youth. Youth A was
standing in the corner of the hallway and was refusing to go back
and sit down. Staff 6 signaled through the window/closed door
that leads to “back hall” a code 2 meaning assistance was
needed. Youth from the pod were taken out of the area. Staff 1
and Staff 6 were trying to verbally deescalate Youth A. Staff 5
was in the main pod area during this time. Staff 5 reported Youth
A started to try to hit staff by swinging his arm and Youth A was
placed in a two-man standing escort to move Youth A from the
hallway to the nearest bedroom. Staff 5 assisted in going to take
everything out of the bedroom and was securing staff radios as
they were falling during the escort. Youth A was fighting the
8

escort and trying to swing his arms out of the staff’s hold. Youth A
grabbed the doorframe of the bedroom while getting escorted into
the bedroom. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were escorting Youth A to the
bedroom. Staff 2 fell once inside the bedroom and Staff 4 was
able to secure Youth A’s arm. Youth A was standing at this time.
Staff 1 and the other staff attempted to release Youth A however
Youth A was still swinging trying to hit staff. Staff 1 called for
more staff to come into the bedroom to assist. Youth A was
making verbal threats that he was going to “beat the shit out of
staff and kill them”. Staff 5 went into the bedroom and secured
Youth A’s leg while Staff 3 secured the other leg. Staff 1 had
Youth A’s left arm secured and Staff 4 had Youth A’s right arm.
Staff were attempting to turn Youth A so he was in position on the
bed where he would be kneeling on the ground which staff in
order for staff to be able to exit the bedroom. While trying to get
Youth A in the position, Youth A stood up causing all the staff to
fall forward as well as Youth A. Youth A hit his eyebrow area on
the sink/toilet which is directly next to the bed. Staff were then
able to get Youth A in the kneeling position and exited the
bedroom. Upon staff exiting the bedroom, Youth A was given the
mattress back as it was bedtime. The nurse was contacted to
come down to look at Youth A’s eyebrow as it was cut and
bleeding. The Sheriff’s Department was contacted and came and
took Youth A to the hospital. Staff 5 reported she had no
concerns with the restraint that was performed as she stated it
was performed per CPI technique.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 11/28/2023. Staff 6
reported what he recalled from the night of 11/8/2023 when he
was working in the back hall was Youth A walked up to the door
that leads to the main pod area and walked out into the pod. Staff
6 reported he thought the door was locked. Staff 6 reported Youth
A was not listening or following directions. Staff 6 remained in the
back hallway with the other two youth and an unknown staff called
code 2. Staff 6 reported some supervisors came and spoke with
Youth A however Staff 6 did not recall who. Staff 6 reported the
supervisors were able to talk Youth A into going back into the
back hallway however he did not know what occurred after that as
he was with the other two youth in the back hallway trying to get
them into their bedrooms for bedtime. Staff 6 reported Youth A
was agitated and described agitated as Youth A talking negative
and refusing to follow directions. Staff 6 reported he did see
Youth A get transported to the bedroom however did not recall
which staff transported Youth A. Staff 6 reported Youth A did not
walk on his own to the bedroom, staff had to escort him. Staff 6
did not know what happened once Youth A was in the bedroom.
9

Staff 6 reported he did not see Youth A hit his head on the
doorframe when getting escorted into the bedroom. Staff 6
reported he did see Youth A after Youth A was in the bedroom
through the window and Youth A had blood on his face. Nursing
was called to come assess Youth A however Youth A refused.
The Sheriff’s Department ended up transporting Youth A to the
hospital for medical treatment. Staff 6 reported when youth are
fighting staff and staff are trying to exit the bedroom safely, youth
are put in positions to allow staff to exit. If you are complying and
listening the youth may be standing and told not to move while
staff exit. When youth fight and don’t following directives, youth
are in a kneeling position facing the bed, with staff securing their
arms on the side, and one staff crosses the youth’s legs and
secures the legs. Staff 6 reported the youth’s legs are crossed so
youth can’t move. Staff 6 reported in these situations the youth do
not willingly go into the kneeling position. Staff 6 reported this is a
last resort for safety. Staff use CPI techniques to get into the
kneeling position. Staff 6 reported there are several staff assisting
in this. Once the youth is kneeling, legs crossed, arms secured by
staff, and the youth is leaning over the bed, one by one staff exit
the bedroom, and the final staff runs out and the door is locked.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 responded to
a code 2 regarding Youth A. Youth A was upset over a snack and
was not following instructions. Youth A was being encouraged to
go to his bedroom as it was bedtime, and he could have his
snack. Supervisor 2 was telling Youth A he would get him his
snack once he followed directions. Supervisor 1 reported he did
not recall all the details and which staff were present. Supervisor
1 recalled Staff 1 and Staff 2 having their hands on Youth A’s
shoulders and back to encourage Youth A to walk down the hall.
Youth A became aggressive and began swinging his arms at
which time Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to put Youth A in a two-
man escort however Youth A was struggling, and Supervisor 1
was unsure if Staff 1 and Staff 2 successfully secured Youth A’s
arms. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were able to get Youth A into the closest
bedroom. Supervisor 1 did not go in the bedroom as Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3, and Staff 5 were in there. Youth A was swing his arms
and kicking staff in attempt to get away. Supervisor 1 told Staff 5
to exit the bedroom. Staff were trying to exit the bedroom. Staff,
unsure who, were trying to get Youth A into a supine position on
the bed and had Youth A’s arms secured at this time. Youth A
was “flipping and flopping” around and Supervisor 1 was unable to
see much. Supervisor 1 did not see Youth A fall and hit his head
however he heard something hit. Supervisor 1 never saw Youth A
10

hit his head while going through the bedroom doorframe.
Supervisor 1 reported staff are trained to get youth in a position to
safely exit the bedroom which could be a supine position or a
kneeling position where the youth face the bed and kneels in front
of it. If youth are struggling, staff are trained to quickly let go of
the youth and get out of the bedroom and close the door.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was not willingly walking in the
escort as Youth A was moving back and forth trying to get away
from Staff 1 and Staff 2. Supervisor 1 reported CPI trains to move
youth in the escort hold however Supervisor 1 was not sure if CPI
trained a technique on what to do if a youth refuses to walk in the
escort hold. Supervisor 1 reported CPI trains if a youth refuses to
walk to stop and hold the escort position or drop to the floor to a
restraint. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 were right at
the doorway with Youth A when he was refusing to walk.
Supervisor 1 reported CPI does not address how staff are to exit a
bedroom safely. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was threatening
to fight staff and making statements he was “going to beat their
ass” and “kill them”. Nursing was called to come assess Youth A
however Youth A refused and so the Sheriff’s Department
transported Youth A to the hospital.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 responded to
the code 2 that was called. Upon entering the unit, Staff 1 was on
Youth A’s right side and Staff 2 was on Youth A’s left side.
Supervisor 2 reported there were other staff present however he
did not recall who. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were coaching Youth A and
trying to get Youth A to walk down the hall. Youth A was refusing
to move. Supervisor 2 stood in front of Youth A to get his
attention and asked him what was going on. Youth A told
Supervisor 2 he wanted his cereal bar snack. Supervisor 2 was
unsure if there were other issues going on however told Youth A,
he would get him his cereal bar and encouraged Youth A to walk
down the hall. Youth A said “no” and smiled and turned his body
away. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were continuing to try to get Youth A to
walk down the hall to his chair. Supervisor 2 reported there were
a lot of staff present and a lot of people talking. Supervisor 2
continued to tell Youth A he would get him a cereal bar and to
follow directions. Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to guide Youth A
to walk down the hall as Staff 1 was patting Youth A’s back and
Staff 2 had one hand on Youth A’s wrist and his other hand on
Youth A’s back. Youth A continued to refuse to move down the
hall and told staff to stop touching him. Staff 1 and Staff 2
continued to try to talk to Youth A to get him to comply and walk
down the hall. Staff 1 and Staff 2 began to escort Youth A down
11

the hall in a CPI technique where there is a staff on each side of
the youth securing the youth’s arms and Supervisor 2 went behind
Youth A so he could talk to Youth A and support him so he would
not fall. Youth A began resisting and was planting his feet into the
ground and tensing up his body. Staff 1 and Staff 2 continue to
escort Youth A to the bedroom as it was close to them.
Supervisor 2 reported several staff went into the bedroom, so he

• Crisis Prevention High Level Holding in a standing position:
High level holding can be used for greater management
(not complete restriction) of movement associated with risk
behavior and/or provide physical support for the individual
in crisis. To gain a high level of restriction, staff should
apply all the principles ensuring they remain as close as
possible. If the youth is presenting with a high-risk
behavior, then staff have to ensure that they are as
restrictive as needed in order to minimize harm. Staff
should consider how to move/transport the youth.
• Crisis Prevention Nonverbal Communication Haptics is
communication through touch. Example of haptics is
placing your hand on the youth’s shoulder and maintaining
a light pressure and observing the youth’s nonverbal
behavior or holding the youth’s wrist and gently beginning
to increase the pressure of the grip until you notice
nonverbal signs of discomfort. The aim of haptics is not to
hurt the youth but to demonstrate the impact of touch.
